name: Filtering profanity for valid texts after adding new valid profanity string

testSteps.description: 1: Filtering profanity for valid texts after adding new valid profanity string ({text=this is awesome, format=json, profanity String=this,some, replacement string=, filtered text=**** is awe****})

children.description: When Siva requests a "this is awesome" after filtering using new "this,some" by replacing with "" in "json"
Filter input text this is awesome by adding new text this,some by replacing  in response format json

restQuery.responseHeaders:
Content-Type: application/json
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
X-Cloud-Trace-Context: 9bd2bffd181c9600e2c3e86bcf062db1
Date: Sun, 18 Jul 2021 22:21:12 GMT
Server: Google Frontend
Content-Length: 28

children.description: Then he should be able to view the "**** is awe****" returned in requested "json"
Validate response 'result' **** is awe**** in format json

testSteps.description: 2: Filtering profanity for valid texts after adding new valid profanity string ({text=this is awesome, format=xml, profanity String=this, replacement string=that, filtered text=that is awesome})

children.description: When Siva requests a "this is awesome" after filtering using new "this" by replacing with "that" in "xml"
Filter input text this is awesome by adding new text this by replacing that in response format xml

Validate response 'result' that is awesome in format xml

testSteps.description: 3: Filtering profanity for valid texts after adding new valid profanity string ({text=this is awesome, format=plain, profanity String=this, replacement string=!, filtered text=! is awesome})

children.description: When Siva requests a "this is awesome" after filtering using new "this" by replacing with "!" in "plain"
